> > It is recommended to run docker in Linux environment.

Currently we support both MacOS and Linux platform to run E2E Test. The compatibility of many images is poor on Windows platform. I haven't found a better way to achieve the same effect of docker on windows and Linux/MacOS platform.

### Search before asking

- [X] I had searched in the [issues](https://github.com/apache/dolphinscheduler/issues?q=is%3Aissue) and found no similar issues.


### What happened

1. I create a project with user **test-user1** **test-project1**
2. Create **test user 2** through the administrator account, and authorize the project **test project 1** to **test user 2**
3. Log in to account **test user 2** , find the project **test project 1** and change the user of the project
4. Log in to the account **test user 1** and find that the item cannot be found **test item 1**
5. This problem occurs in both versions **2.0.2** and **2.0.3**

### What you expected to happen

1. Either **test user 2** cannot change the user of the project, or continue to maintain the **test user 1** ownership of the test project

### How to reproduce

1. Log in to the administrator account **admin**
2. Create User **Test User1**
3. Create User **Test User2**
4. Login account **test user 1**, create project **test project 1**
5. Log in to the administrator account **admin** and authorize the project **test project 1** for **test user 2**
6. Log in to the account **test user 2**, enter the project interface, and change the user of **test project 1**
7. Log in to the account **test user 1** to check the effect

### Anything else

_No response_

### Version

2.0.3

### Are you willing to submit PR?

- [ ] Yes I am willing to submit a PR!

### Code of Conduct

- [X] I agree to follow this project's [Code of Conduct](https://www.apache.org/foundation/policies/conduct)
